titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Peter Rutledge Koch is a San Francisco Bay Area printer and one of the leading modern printers and designers of the fine press book. Born in Montana, he traveled to Europe and Africa before completing a bachelor's degree in philosophy at the University of Montana. He then spent time in Paris and Amsterdam, where he was heavily influenced by the work of Andr√©e Breton and Max Ernst. Three years later he launched his first publication, Montana Gothic, a poetry journal which was awarded the Pushcart Prize for the Best of Small Presses. From there, his career took off, but his work remained grounded in geography and a sense of place, filled with western themes, images, and even found-objects.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of printed materials produced by printer, Peter Koch. Items in the collection include business cards, book plates, announcements, pamphlets, invitations, coasters, programs, stationery, periodicals, books, signs, catalogs, and posters.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/kochpp.htm.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Delaware: Black Stone Press Archive.
